name: Depression
description: Your sadness and fatigue are valid responses to the load you’ve been carrying.

description: It’s understandable that constant pressure leaves you feeling on edge.

description: You’ve been carrying a lot—it’s okay to pause and take a breath together.

description: Swap ‘I can’t handle this’ for ‘This is hard, but I can take one step.’

description: My brain is protecting me from danger—even if it misfires, I’m not broken.

description: Rest is a responsible act, not a failure.

description: Your grief is real—there’s no timetable for loss.

description: Many people feel waves of sadness months or years after losing someone.

description: I’m here to sit with you and honor their memory—you don’t have to do this alone.

description: Cravings and slips don’t mean you’ve failed—they mean recovery is challenging and ongoing.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: I’m glad you reached out—you don’t have to fight this battle alone.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: I thought I’d never get sober, but connecting with others made the difference.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: Seeking help shows courage, not weakness.

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: It makes sense you doubt yourself when expectations feel so high.

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: Even accomplished people often feel like imposters—you’re not alone.

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: Swap ‘I don’t belong here’ for ‘I earned this role and I’m still learning.’

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: I can be proud of my progress even if I don’t know everything.

name: Loneliness
description: Feeling disconnected can be painful—it doesn’t mean you’re unworthy.

name: Loneliness
description: I’d like to spend time with you—you matter and you’re not invisible.

name: Loneliness
description: When I felt isolated, reaching out once a day helped me feel connected again.

name: Perfectionism
description: Striving to be flawless can be exhausting—it makes sense you feel worn out.

name: Perfectionism
description: Swap ‘If it isn’t perfect, it’s worthless’ for ‘Done is better than perfect.’

name: Perfectionism
description: You are worthy even when things aren’t flawless.

name: Moral Injury
description: Carrying guilt from events that clashed with your descriptions is a human struggle.

name: Moral Injury
description: You acted under impossible circumstances—you still deserve compassion.

name: Moral Injury
description: After my experience, sharing my story with others helped me start healing.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: Feeling low after birth doesn’t make you a bad parent—it shows how big this change is.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: Talking about how overwhelmed you feel is brave—you’re not alone in this.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: I can care for myself as I learn to care for my baby.

name: Health Anxiety
description: It makes sense you worry when your body feels different.

name: Health Anxiety
description: Your fears are real for you—I’ll listen without judgment.

name: Health Anxiety
description: Swap ‘This symptom means disaster’ for ‘It may be uncomfortable but not always dangerous.’

name: Depression
description: Set one small goal, like taking a shower or stepping outside, to build momentum.

name: Depression
description: Behavioral activation: schedule one enjoyable or meaningful activity for the day.

name: Depression
description: If sadness feels unbearable or you have thoughts of harm, call your local emergency number or 988 in the U.S.

name: Anxiety
description: Practice box breathing—inhale for 4, hold 4, exhale 4, hold 4—to steady your body.

name: Anxiety
description: Grounding with five senses: name five things you see, four you feel, three you hear, two you smell, one you taste.

name: Anxiety
description: If anxiety escalates into panic, move to a safe space, slow your breath, and call a support person.

name: PTSD
description: Step away from reminders, use a grounding object, and notice three things in the present moment.

name: PTSD
description: DBT TIP skill: change body chemistry—splash cold water on your face to activate the dive reflex and calm arousal.

name: PTSD
description: If flashbacks feel overwhelming, focus on your breath, hold something solid, and reach out to a trusted contact or 988.

name: Burnout
description: Take a 10-minute pause, hydrate, and stretch—small breaks protect energy during long shifts.

name: Burnout
description: Mindful pause: stop, notice your breath for one minute, then return to task with intention.

name: Grief
description: Write a letter to the person you lost to express what feels unfinished.

name: Grief
description: Memory box: gather photos or items that honor the person, and revisit them during difficult moments.

name: Insomnia
description: Get out of bed if awake for more than 20 minutes—do a calm activity until sleepy again.

name: Insomnia
description: Stimulus control: reserve the bed only for sleep and intimacy, not screens or worry.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: Call a recovery sponsor, attend a meeting, or replace cravings with a short walk.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: Urge surfing: notice a craving rise and fall like a wave without acting on it.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: If you feel unsafe or at risk of relapse, reach out immediately to a sponsor, counselor, or call 988 in the U.S.

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: Write down three recent accomplishments and what skills helped you achieve them.

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: Shift from ‘I got lucky’ to ‘I prepared and put in effort that paid off.’

name: Perfectionism
description: Set a time limit on tasks to prevent endless editing or checking.

name: Perfectionism
description: Thought record: identify a critical thought, list evidence for and against it, then write a balanced alternative.

name: Moral Injury
description: Talk with a trusted peer about the conflict and explore ways to reconnect with your descriptions.

name: Moral Injury
description: descriptions clarification: write down top five descriptions and one action aligned with each.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: Ask for concrete support with feeding, rest, and chores—small breaks protect mental health.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: If you feel like you might harm yourself or your baby, call your local emergency number or 988 in the U.S.

name: Panic Disorder
description: Slow your breathing with a 4-4-6 rhythm—in for 4, hold 4, out for 6.

name: Panic Disorder
description: Interoceptive exposure: practice tolerating mild body sensations like faster heartbeat in a safe setting.

name: Panic Disorder
description: If panic feels overwhelming, sit down, breathe slowly, and if unsafe call your local emergency number or 988 in the U.S.

name: Social Anxiety Disorder
description: Prepare one supportive phrase for yourself before entering a social situation.

name: Social Anxiety Disorder
description: Graded exposure: list feared situations from easiest to hardest and practice step by step.

name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
description: Delay rituals for five minutes and focus attention on another activity.

name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
description: Exposure and response prevention: gradually face triggers without performing the compulsion.

name: Bipolar I Disorder
description: Track mood and sleep daily to notice early changes.

name: Bipolar I Disorder
description: Mood charting: log sleep, energy, and stress to see patterns.

name: Bipolar I Disorder
description: If energy spikes with little sleep and risky urges, contact your treatment team or crisis services immediately.

name: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder
description: Use timers and alarms to break tasks into short work sprints.

name: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder
description: Task chunking: write steps in small, checkable parts and reward completion.

name: Schizophrenia
description: Keep a daily routine of meals, sleep, and light activity for structure.

name: Schizophrenia
description: Reality testing: write down a thought and review with a trusted person for accuracy.

name: Schizophrenia
description: If voices or beliefs urge harm, move to a safe space and call your local emergency number or 988 in the U.S.

name: Anorexia Nervosa
description: Practice eating with a supportive friend and avoid food rituals.

name: Anorexia Nervosa
description: Body neutrality practice: list body functions you description beyond appearance.

name: Anorexia Nervosa
description: If urges to restrict or purge feel uncontrollable, reach out immediately to a clinician or 988 in the U.S.

name: Bulimia Nervosa
description: Plan three balanced meals and two snacks daily to reduce binge triggers.

name: Bulimia Nervosa
description: Urge surfing: ride out binge or purge urges by noticing how they rise and fall.

name: Bulimia Nervosa
description: If purging feels unmanageable or health is at risk, seek medical help immediately or call 988 in the U.S.

name: Body Dysmorphic Disorder
description: Limit mirror checking to set times and durations.

name: Body Dysmorphic Disorder
description: Cognitive reappraisal: challenge distorted body thoughts by writing balanced alternatives.

name: Grief
description: Create a daily ritual, like lighting a candle, to honor the person you lost.

name: Grief
description: Journaling: write letters to the person expressing thoughts and memories.

name: Adjustment Disorder
description: Identify one aspect of the stressor you can control and act on it.

name: Adjustment Disorder
description: Problem-solving worksheet: define the problem, brainstorm solutions, pick one small step.

name: Moral Injury
description: Talk openly with a trusted peer about the event and reflect on descriptions you still hold.

name: Moral Injury
description: descriptions clarification: write down your top descriptions and plan one action that aligns with them today.

name: Moral Injury
description: If guilt or shame feels overwhelming or unsafe, reach out immediately to crisis services or call 988 in the U.S.

name: Perfectionism
description: Set realistic deadlines and intentionally stop tasks at ‘good enough.’

name: Perfectionism
description: Thought record: write a perfectionistic belief, then list balanced alternatives.

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: Keep a journal of successes and review them before high-stakes tasks.

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: Cognitive reframing: replace ‘I don’t belong here’ with ‘I earned this role through effort.’

name: Loneliness
description: Schedule one small point of contact daily, such as a call or text to a friend.

name: Loneliness
description: Graded social exposure: start with brief, safe interactions and build up gradually.

name: Insomnia
description: Keep a consistent wake time every day, even after poor sleep.

name: Insomnia
description: Sleep diary: track bedtime, wake time, naps, and energy to see patterns.

name: Insomnia
description: If exhaustion leads to unsafe functioning at work, notify a supervisor and seek immediate support.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: Arrange regular breaks by asking trusted others for help with the baby.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: Bonding time: spend 5 minutes of skin-to-skin contact with your baby to strengthen connection.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: If you feel like harming yourself or your baby, seek immediate help by calling local emergency services or 988 in the U.S.

name: Health Anxiety
description: Limit checking behaviors by setting a fixed time of day for health concerns.

name: Health Anxiety
description: Exposure exercise: resist googling a symptom and notice the anxiety gradually lessen.

name: Anger Dysregulation
description: Take a brief time-out when you feel escalation, then return once calmer.

name: Anger Dysregulation
description: DBT STOP skill: Stop, Take a breath, Observe what’s happening, Proceed mindfully.

name: Anger Dysregulation
description: If anger escalates to risk of harm, step away immediately and contact crisis support or 988 in the U.S.

name: Depression
description: Employee assistance program, community mental health clinic, or a licensed counselor.

name: Depression
description: If low mood lasts more than two weeks or interferes with work and home life.

name: Depression
description: Fear of being judged or seen as weak for asking for help.

name: Depression
description: If you ever feel like giving up, please call your local emergency number or 988 in the U.S. for immediate support.

name: Anxiety
description: Primary care provider, workplace counselor, or support group for anxiety.

name: Anxiety
description: If worry feels uncontrollable most days or prevents normal activities.

name: Anxiety
description: Concern that others will minimize or dismiss their anxiety.

name: PTSD
description: Trauma-informed therapist, veterans’ services, or community crisis line.

name: PTSD
description: If trauma reminders cause intense reactions that disrupt daily life.

name: PTSD
description: If flashbacks or distress feel unbearable, call your local emergency number or 988 in the U.S.

name: Burnout
description: Supervisor check-in, occupational health service, or workplace counselor.

name: Burnout
description: If exhaustion and cynicism persist despite rest or affect job performance.

name: Burnout
description: Fear of being seen as uncommitted or lazy for speaking up.

name: Grief
description: Grief support group, faith leader, or community mental health center.

name: Grief
description: If grief prevents basic functioning or leads to unsafe coping.

name: Grief
description: Belief that seeking help dishonors the person lost.

name: Insomnia
description: Sleep clinic, behavioral sleep therapist, or primary care provider.

name: Insomnia
description: If poor sleep persists more than three nights a week for several weeks.

name: Insomnia
description: Worry that sleep issues aren’t serious enough for medical attention.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: Recovery sponsor, SAMHSA helpline (1-800-662-HELP in the U.S.), or treatment program.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: If substance use continues despite harm or control feels impossible.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: Fear of losing employment if struggles are disclosed.

name: Substance Use Disorder
description: If you feel at risk of harming yourself or relapsing, please call 988 in the U.S. or your local crisis line.

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: Mentorship programs, workplace peer support, or a counselor specializing in performance stress.

name: Imposter Syndrome
description: If self-doubt significantly limits advancement or daily functioning.

name: Loneliness
description: Community groups, peer support networks, or workplace buddy programs.

name: Loneliness
description: If isolation leads to despair or unsafe coping like substance use.

name: Loneliness
description: Belief that reaching out will burden others.

name: Perfectionism
description: Cognitive-behavioral therapist or coaching support for performance stress.

name: Perfectionism
description: If perfectionistic pressure drives avoidance, anxiety, or burnout.

name: Moral Injury
description: Trauma-informed clinician, peer support group, or chaplain services.

name: Moral Injury
description: If guilt, shame, or moral conflict leads to despair or self-harm thoughts.

name: Moral Injury
description: If guilt becomes unbearable or you consider harming yourself, call your local emergency number or 988 in the U.S.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: OB-GYN, maternal mental health specialist, or postpartum peer support group.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: If sadness or detachment lasts more than two weeks and interferes with caring for the baby.

name: Postpartum Depression
description: Fear of being judged as a bad parent.

name: Health Anxiety
description: Primary care provider or therapist specializing in health-related anxiety.

name: Health Anxiety
description: If worry about health dominates daily life despite medical reassurance.

name: Health Anxiety
description: Fear that concerns will be dismissed as ‘all in your head.’

name: Anger Dysregulation
description: Anger management groups, cognitive-behavioral therapist, or peer mentor.

name: Anger Dysregulation
description: If anger outbursts cause harm, legal issues, or repeated regret.

name: Anger Dysregulation
description: If you feel close to harming yourself or others, step away and call local emergency services or 988 in the U.S.
